STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 8, 2020
Ottawa County DHHS
12185 James Street
Holland, MI 49424
RE: License #: CP700201350
Ottawa County DHHS
12185 James Street
Holland, MI 49424
Dear Ms. Spanjer:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed September 28
– October 7, 2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the policy
and MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your contract.
The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule, section of policy, or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at, (616)552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
(269) 330-7082
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CP700201350
Licensee Name: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Address: 235 South Grand Avenue
Lansing, MI 48902
Licensee Telephone #: (517) 373-3768

Name of Facility: Ottawa County DHHS
Facility Address: 12185 James Street
Holland, MI 49424
Facility Telephone #: (616) 394-7200

CERTIFY FOSTER HOMES FOR LICENSE

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.49 Medical Passports
(a) At the time the child is placed or re-placed, the foster
care provider shall receive the child’s Medical Passport,
which must contain the information required by MCL
722.954c(2) and DHHS Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-1-2015) (or
any successor policies approved by the Monitors). And at
least quarterly thereafter, an updated Medical Passport
must be prepared, as required by the “Medical Passports”
section of DHHS Policy FOM 801 (dated 3-1-2015) (or any
successor policy approved by the Monitors) and provided
to the foster care provider.
Four of eight foster care files reviewed did not have all the required medical passports
on file. This is a repeat violation cited in the 2019 Licensing Inspection Report
dated 8/21/19 for which a CAP was approved on 9/3/20 and the 2018 Licensing
Inspection Report dated 9/12/18 for which a CAP for this violation was approved
on 10/10/18.
ISEP 6.33 Assessments and Service Plans, Content (Commitment 69).
(c) Service plans shall be signed by the caseworker, the
caseworker’s supervisor, the parent(s), and the child(ren), if
of age to participate. If the parent(s) or child(ren) or both
are not available or decline to sign the plan, the service
plan shall include an explanation of the steps taken to
involve them and shall identify any follow-up actions to be
taken to secure their participation in services.
CI 17-096 Treatment Plan Signature Timeframes and
Documentation Requirements
All treatment plans with a report date of August 1, 2017, or
later must have signatures from all appropriate case
members within 30 days of the report date.
Seven of eleven case files reviewed (8 foster care and 3 IL) did not meet the
requirements for obtaining signatures. This is a repeat violation cited in the 2019
Licensing Inspection Report dated 8/21/19 for which a CAP was approved on
4

9/3/20 and the 2018 Licensing Inspection Report dated 9/12/18 for which a CAP
for this violation was approved on 10/10/18.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS /Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy requirements
except for the following:
FOM 722-03 Placement Exception Requests
Caseworker contact with children in out of home
placement.
A placement must not be made if it will result in one of the
following:
 Siblings placed apart
Exceptions to these limitations may be made on an individual
basis when it is determined to be in the best interest of the
child being placed
One of two foster care files reviewed that required a PER did not have a PER for a
sibling split for the entirety of the split. This is a repeat violation cited in the 2019
Licensing Inspection Report dated 8/21/19 for which a CAP was approved on
9/3/20 and the 2018 Licensing Inspection Report dated 9/12/18 for which a CAP
for this violation was approved on 10/10/18
FOM 722-08E Foster Care Action Summaries
Which Cases/When
All foster care cases where there is:
A replacement.
Termination from foster care placement.
A change in FC worker.
Agency change/transfer to another FC agency (if less than
30 days of completion of last case service plan).
A change in the parent's living situation.
Case closing (if less than 30 days of completion of last
case service plan).
Prior to a planned placement change, or within three business
days of an emergency placement change
Within three business days of foster care and/or juvenile justice
program/case closure
5

One of three foster care files reviewed that required an action summary did not have
one completed within the required timeframes. This is a repeat violation cited in
the 2019 Licensing Inspection Report dated 8/21/19 for which a CAP was
approved on 9/3/20 and the 2018 Licensing Inspection Report dated 9/12/18 for
which a CAP for this violation was approved on 10/10/18
722-06B Family Team Meeting
The Family Team Meeting (FTM) is an essential component
of MiTEAM, Michigan’s Child Welfare Practice Model. FTMs
serve as the primary forum for safety planning,
collaborative service planning, service identification, and
assessing progress. The FTM represents a child-centered,
family-driven, strength-based, team-guided approach,
designed to engage families in developing plans for the
safety, permanency and well-being of their children and
family….
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days before the case plan
due date.
Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date.
Three of eleven open case files reviewed did not have the required FTM’s
throughout the duration of the case. This is a repeat violation cited in the 2019
Licensing Inspection Report dated 8/21/19 for which a CAP was approved on
9/3/20 and the 2018 Licensing Inspection Report dated 9/12/18 for which a CAP
for this violation was approved on 10/10/18
FOM 722-06H Caseworker Contact
Caseworker contact with children in out of home placement.
Subsequent Months
The caseworker must have at least one face-to-face contact
with the child each calendar month. At least one contact each
calendar month must take place at the child’s placement
location. Each contact must include a private meeting between
the child and the caseworker; see Private Meeting in this item.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have the required monthly home visit.
This is a repeat violation cited in the 2019 Licensing Inspection Report dated
8/21/19 for which a CAP was approved on 9/3/20 and the 2018 Licensing
Inspection Report dated 9/12/18 for which a CAP for this violation was approved
on 10/10/18
6

722-09 UPDATED SERVICE PLAN REQUIREMENTS
Case service plan approval process requires the foster care
supervisor to:
 Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of the
report date.
Two of eleven open case files reviewed contained one USP that was not approved
within the required timeframe.
722-06B FTM PRACTICE GUIDANCE
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information,
needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the safety
plan, and any recommendations made for the family during
the FTM. The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for
every FTM.
One of eleven open case files reviewed was missing one 1105.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance regarding appropriate documentation of
the worker’s attempt to review PATP’s with all parties involved and obtain
signatures. Several signature pages or documentation of attempts to obtain
signatures had to be provided during the course of the inspection.
Several documents were not uploaded at the time of initial review, rather had to be
provided only after being found to be missing. More regular internal case file reviews
would reduce the number of missing document and ensure complete files, as
required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require any consultation at the time of the review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
7

DCWL Analyst Safety Concern:
There were no safety concerns observed during the home inspections.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
During the inspection entrance meeting, the Chief Administrator discussed her
findings, which were consistent with the findings of the inspection.
Interviews
The staff and supervisors interviewed reported no concerns with the program. They
indicate that, despite the challenges brought about by working from home and
service restrictions, they have maintained good communication with their peers,
supervisors, and the administration. They reported that this has helped them
maintain family services as well as rule/policy compliance during this period under
review.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
MISEP requirements or policy. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan,
it is recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
October 8, 2020
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 8, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
